faq.whatIsZim: This is the question asking about the Zim file format.
faq.whatIsZimDesc: This provides a brief description of what a Zim file is.
faq.howToRead: This is the question asking how to read Zim files.
faq.howToReadDesc: This provides instructions on how to read Zim files using Kiwix.
faq.missingContent: This is the question about incomplete or missing content in Zim files.
faq.missingContentDesc: This provides an explanation for why some content may be missing or incomplete in Zim files.
faq.gotError: This is the question about encountering error messages when using Zim files.
faq.gotErrorDesc: This provides instructions on what to do if errors are encountered when using Zim files.

app.poweredByKiwix: This indicates that the application is powered by Kiwix.
app.poweredByWebrecorder: This indicates that the application is powered by Webrecorder.
app.thanksToMozilla: This acknowledges support from Mozilla through an Open-Source Support Award.

loading.loading: This is the loading message displayed during data loading.

navbar.logoAlt: This is the alternative text for the logo image.

newRequest.heading: This is the heading for initiating a new request.
newRequest.boldZim: This highlights the action of creating a Zim file.
newRequest.urlPlaceholder: This is the placeholder text for entering a website URL.
newRequest.emailPlaceholder: This is the placeholder text for entering an email address.
newRequest.submit: This is the label for the submit button.
newRequest.advancedOptions: This indicates a link to advanced options.

notFound.heading: This is the heading displayed when content is not found.
notFound.description: This is the description explaining the 404 error.

request.requestingSlot: This indicates the process of requesting a slot on the server.
request.zimingOf: This indicates the process of converting a website into a ZIM file.
request.requestRecorded: This confirms that a user's request has been recorded.
request.requestFailed: This indicates that a request has failed.
request.failureReasons: This provides reasons for why a request might fail.
request.linkExpires: This explains that the download link will expire after a week.
request.download: This is the label for the download button.
request.limitHit: This indicates that a user has reached a limit.
request.beingProcessed: This indicates that a request is currently being processed.
request.serverConverting: This indicates that a server is converting a URL into a ZIM file.
request.emailNotification: This informs the user about receiving an email notification.
